Key Match Events: Jayson Tatum dropped a game-high 29 points to lead the Celtics to a hard-fought win over the Nuggets at Ball Arena.
Kristaps Porzingis starred with 25 points and 11 rebounds.
The back-and-forth matchup was decided in the fourth quarter when the Celtics ripped off a 15-0 run to pull away from the scrappy, short-handed Nuggets.
Denver kept it close throughout the game despite missing its superstar, Nikola Jokic.
The game featured 10 lead changes and eight ties.
Boston sealed the win with a 15-0 run during the fourth quarter.
Jayson Tatum (29 points, six assists) and Kristaps Porzingis (25 points, 11 rebounds) were the stars for the Celtics.
Jrue Holiday (19 points, seven assists) and Jaylen Brown (14 points, eight rebounds, eight assists) also played significant roles.
Sam Hauser chipped in with nine points on three 3s off the bench.
Kristaps Porzingis notched a team-high 24 points with 10 rebounds, two assists, two steals, and an emphatic block on DeAndre Jordan.
Russell Westbrook made as many 3-pointers (4-7) as the entire Celtics starting lineup (4-16).
Jaylen Brown helped the Celtics regain the lead in the third quarter with eight points (3-7 FG) to go with six assists and three rebounds.
Neemias Queta made his presence felt in the second quarter with eight points (4-5 FG) and a steal in eight minutes off the bench.
Michael Porter Jr. and Russell Westbrook both hit a pair of 3s for the Nuggets.
Kristaps Porzingis exited the game late in the first quarter after being kicked between the legs but returned minutes later.
Jayson Tatum followed his emphatic block with a beautiful lob to Kristaps Porzingis on the other end.
Kristaps Porzingis propelled Boston to an early lead with nine points in five minutes.
Pre-Game Insights: Nuggets head coach Michael Malone said, 'No matter what you do, they’re gonna get 50 3s up.'
Nuggets star Nikola Jokic was a late scratch from the Nuggets lineup due to an illness.
The Celtics ruled out Derrick White and Jordan Walsh for the game due to non-COVID illnesses.
Post-Match Reflections: Jrue Holiday praised Kristaps Porzingis for his standout performance vs. the Nuggets.
Kristaps Porzingis spoke to NBC Sports Boston's Abby Chin after his 25-point, 11-rebound performance vs. Denver.
Eddie House and the Celtics Postgame Live crew reacted to the Celtics finishing their road trip with a win over the Nuggets.
